section.title: Create and manage images
section.para: ICT assigns roles to users. Roles determine who can upload and manage images. The operator might restrict image upload and management to only cloud administrators or operators.
If you have admin privileges, you can use the dashboard to create and manage images in the admin project.

note.title: Manage images by using clients and APIs
note.para: You can also use the glance and nova command-line clients or the Image Service and Compute APIs to manage images. See .

section.title: Create images
section.para: For details about image creation, see the Virtual Machine Image Guide.

step.para: Choose the admin project from the CURRENT PROJECT drop-down list.
On the Project tab, click the Images & Snapshots category.
Click Create Image. The Create An Image window appears:
In the Create An Image window, enter or select the following values:

td.para: Enter a name for the image.
Enter a brief description about the image.
Include the URL of the image.
Alternatively, browse to find the file on your machine.
Select this option to make the image public to all users.
Select this option to ensure that only users with permissions can delete it.

step.para: The image is queued to be uploaded. It might take some time before the status changes from queued to active.
Choose the admin project from the CURRENT PROJECT drop-down list.
On the Project tab, click the Images & Snapshots category.
Select the image that you want to edit. In the More drop-down list, click Edit.
In the Update Image window, you can change the name for the image. Select the Public check box to make the image public. Clear this check box to make the image private.
Choose the admin project from the CURRENT PROJECT drop-down list.
On the Project tab, click the Images & Snapshots category.
Select the images that you want to delete.
In the Confirm Delete Image window, click Delete Images to confirm the deletion. You cannot undo this action.
